Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2010 09:08AM Ndwmel wrote: Thank you Debbie and Kira, it's nice to be able to come to a place and actually have WOMEN KNOW what I am going thru.  I just found the favorite quote topic, I very much enjoy reading them.  Yesterday not such a good day, TODAY feels like it will be a great day.  Happy Monday.  Nikia
Posts.Title: Is how I'm feeling Normal? Ndwmel Ndwmel

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2011 06:37AM Ndwmel wrote: Hi ladies, came across a forum that is right in line with where I am at.  I had my umx 10/21/10, &  TE 11/30, due to infection have only had 3 fills, PS and I are thinking March will be my exchange too, but no date set yet.    I will be definately looking here as March comes around to hear how all of you are doing after your exchange.   This is such a wonderful place, really helps with the mental process.
Posts.Title: October 2010 Mastectomy cc4npg cc4npg

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2010 05:06PM Ndwmel wrote: I had my masectomy 10/21, still have one draining tube, hoping to get out tomorrow YEAH.  Glad to read I am not the only one feeling fatigue.  I was very sore up till last Thursday, I am just starting to feel a little normal,   I have just accomplished the raise my arm and press against my ear, looks like I may be having my expander surgery, the week after Thanksgiving.   What new pain/experience am I going to have to endure now?
Posts.Title: October 2010 Mastectomy cc4npg cc4npg

Posts.Content: Ndwmel wrote: I was diagnosed 9/3/10 DCIS 11.2cm and 1.1cm tumor, had a left masectomy with 2 lymph nodes removed, all negative, no chemo or radiation 10/21/10.  Two drains initially, down to one, I was a 34GG before surgery, they left quite a bit a skin for me to help with my reconstruction.  Although I've been working from home for over a week, and get out a bit, I FEEL AWFUL, not just physically, but emotionally, I am sore, feel like a ton of bricks is on my chest, I orignally had fluid that would drain down into my open left over skin flap which hurt every time I stood up, it would get hard during the day while I was up and about,  but relaxed while lying down, sore to the touch, bending, just doing day to day life is a chore.   Today I had a Dr. Appt. and I felt like I was suppose to be in less pain, was told I had a low tolerance, that I should be feeling better, perhaps I'd like some aniexty meds, really?? I am having reconstruction surgery and could within the next week, but for me, I can't get pass the pain I'm having, why would I subject myself for another surgery so soon, while my body is already feeling so bad, I'm thinking I should wait, but some say, just get it over with, continue with the pain?  I am also emotionally drained, I had been in a car accident 8/13, suffered a concusion, then this a few weeks later.  To me my feelings are normal, my friends and family despite how much support they are not going thru what I am, I am a single mom, two kids and trying my best to be normal, but it's just not in me yet. Thank you for letting me share, I found this site by searching: the recovery time from a expander surgery - just happy I can read what others are going thru, make me feel a bit saner. Nikia Dx 9/14/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Is how I'm feeling Normal? Ndwmel Ndwmel

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2010 09:56AM Ndwmel wrote: Shelly - Thank yo I am having my TE surgery TODAY!  I was able to feel a bit of normalcy for Thanksgiving, with very little pain, not that I want another round of pain,  I am ready for the next step in this long journey, so glad to have so many women to come for advice.
